String specifying content start for search
String specifying content end for search
String specifying exclude content start for search
String specifying exclude content end for search
Set a crawler login, so protected pages can be crawled. logged in users can than find their protected pages. You also need to define a static class & method to get the current users valid groups.
Forcing crawler start with next maintenance.
Enable and configure the search frontend if you want to include a full text search on your website.

Check to receive search results from all languages, uncheck to limit search results to the current language only. The current language is retrieved from the registy, the language of any page in the search result index is extracted by the crawler (Content-Language Http header, html tag lang attribute or html meta tag content-language)

Check to receive search results from all countries, uncheck to limit search results to country only. The current country is retrieved from the search result index. it is extracted by the crawler (html meta tag country)
Check to ignore Document restrictions. uncheck if you use the pimcore-members plugin.
Check to limt search results to results from the current (sub-)domain only

You can limit the page content relevant for searching by surrounding it with certain html comments. The crawler will still parse the entire page to find links, but only the specified area wihin your html comments is used when searching for a term
If search results should be displayed by categories, please enter all valid categories here. The crawler sorts a page into a category if it contains a html meta tag with the name cat
Define which url Schemes are allowed. (eg. http, https). Default is http.

Specify start URLs for the crawler. Please enter with protocol! e.g. http://www.pimcore.org and enter a starting URL on your main domain first and any subdomains next, because the domain of the first URL will be used as the main domain for sitemap generation
Specify PREG regexes with start and end delimiter to define allowed links. e.g. @^http://www\\.pimcore\\.org.*@i
Specify PREG regexes for links which should be ignored by the crawler. The crawler does not even follow these links e.g. @.*www\\.pimcore\\.org\\/community.*@i
You can exclude objects/assets/documents from being indexed by the backend crawler
If pcntl is enabled in php, the crawler starts several parallel threads to extract links and pages from the target site.
"These fields are mandatory for the crawler to work"
"Crawler ist not ready to be started. Please complete crawler configuration below"
To avoid loops produced by relative links on a website, a maximum link depth needs to be set. Please choose the value suited to the website to crawl, the default value is 15
Constrain crawler to a specific limit of crawled links. Defaults is 0 which means no limit.
crawler ignores resources if its size exceeds limit (mostly useful for asset indexing). Defaults is 0 which means no limit.

The crawler did not respond to the stop command within the last 10 Seconds, do you want to force stop it? Forcing the stop does not guarantee that all child processes have finished. It is advised to wait a couple of minutes before starting the crawler again.
When checked, a fuzzy search for similar search terms is performed. If no results could be found for the search term entered by the user, similar search terms are presented as suggestions
